column4: i've done this but i still the sun site still tells me java isn't installed.  what gives? "sudo aptitude install sun-java6-jre sun-java6-plugin sun-java6-fonts"
dont install java from pkgs
why not?
just download the .bin java dist from java.sun.com and put a symlink to the .so in your browser's plugin dir
i dunno. i've never used them. commercial s/w that is managed by apt is usually shit
well, if the packages are broken i'm sure the good maintainers would want to fix them.
sun java barely ever changes... might as well just install it once and forget about it
and stick JAVA_HOME and PATH in your /etc/profile
errr, i install it once for each version and once on each machine.
each version?
i know. but not in anyway you need to worry about
and 1.4 before that and so on.
why would you want to install those
why would you want to assume what i'm installing?
you just implied your installing multiple versions of java and that thus is the root of your problem,
i didn't imply anything.  i said i installed java and show the command but get the browser tells me i need to install the jre
because the plugin clearly didn't work. and i said link it by habd. installing the java plugin is literally just crreating a symbloic link
like i said, i know how to install java manually.  i'm curious why installing via the packages didn't work.
well file a bug and dont worry about it
you tpyed it wrong
if i determine it's not something goofy with my setup i will.
